2962 * do so, if it's not already enabled.
2963 */
2964 if ((req.ifm_current & IFM_IEEE80211_MONITOR) == 0) {
2965 /*
2966 * Monitor mode isn't currently on, so turn it on,
2967 * and remember that we should turn it off when the
2968 * pcap_t is closed.
2969 */
2970
2971 /*
2972 * If we haven't already done so, arrange to have
2973 * "pcap_close_all()" called when we exit.
2974 */
2975 if (!pcap_do_addexit(p)) {
2976 /*
2977 * "atexit()" failed; don't put the interface
2978 * in monitor mode, just give up.
2979 */
2980 close(sock);
2981 return (PCAP_ERROR);
2982 }
2983 memset(&ifr, 0, sizeof(ifr));
2984 (void)strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, p->opt.device,
2985 sizeof(ifr.ifr_name));
2986 ifr.ifr_media = req.ifm_current | IFM_IEEE80211_MONITOR;
2987 if (ioctl(sock, SIOCSIFMEDIA, &ifr) == -1) {
2988 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf,
2989 PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE, errno, "SIOCSIFMEDIA");
2990 close(sock);
2991 return (PCAP_ERROR);
2992 }
2993
2994 pb->must_do_on_close |= MUST_CLEAR_RFMON;
2995
2996 /*
2997 * Add this to the list of pcaps to close when we exit.
2998 */
2999 pcap_add_to_pcaps_to_close(p);
3000 }
3001 }
3002 return (0);
3003}
3004#endif /* HAVE_BSD_IEEE80211 */
3005
3006#if defined(BIOCGDLTLIST) && (defined(__APPLE__) || defined(HAVE_BSD_IEEE80211))
3007/*
3008 * Check whether we have any 802.11 link-layer types; return the best
3009 * of the 802.11 link-layer types if we find one, and return -1
3010 * otherwise.
3011 *
3012 * DLT_IEEE802_11_RADIO, with the radiotap header, is considered the
3013 * best 802.11 link-layer type; any of the other 802.11-plus-radio
3014 * headers are second-best; 802.11 with no radio information is
3015 * the least good.
3016 */
3017static int
3018find_802_11(struct bpf_dltlist *bdlp)
3019{
3020 int new_dlt;
3021 u_int i;
3022
3023 /*
3024 * Scan the list of DLT_ values, looking for 802.11 values,
3025 * and, if we find any, choose the best of them.
3026 */
3027 new_dlt = -1;
3028 for (i = 0; i < bdlp->bfl_len; i++) {
3029 switch (bdlp->bfl_list[i]) {
3030
3031 case DLT_IEEE802_11:
3032 /*
3033 * 802.11, but no radio.
3034 *
3035 * Offer this, and select it as the new mode
3036 * unless we've already found an 802.11
3037 * header with radio information.
3038 */
3039 if (new_dlt == -1)
3040 new_dlt = bdlp->bfl_list[i];
3041 break;
3042
3043 case DLT_PRISM_HEADER:
3044 case DLT_AIRONET_HEADER:
3045 case DLT_IEEE802_11_RADIO_AVS:
3046 /*
3047 * 802.11 with radio, but not radiotap.
3048 *
3049 * Offer this, and select it as the new mode
3050 * unless we've already found the radiotap DLT_.
3051 */
3052 if (new_dlt != DLT_IEEE802_11_RADIO)
3053 new_dlt = bdlp->bfl_list[i];
3054 break;
3055
3056 case DLT_IEEE802_11_RADIO:
3057 /*
3058 * 802.11 with radiotap.
3059 *
3060 * Offer this, and select it as the new mode.
3061 */
3062 new_dlt = bdlp->bfl_list[i];
3063 break;
3064
3065 default:
3066 /*
3067 * Not 802.11.
3068 */
3069 break;
3070 }
3071 }
3072
3073 return (new_dlt);
3074}
3075#endif /* defined(BIOCGDLTLIST) && (defined(__APPLE__) || defined(HAVE_BSD_IEEE80211)) */
3076
3077#if defined(__APPLE__) && defined(BIOCGDLTLIST)
3078/*
3079 * Remove DLT_EN10MB from the list of DLT_ values, as we're in monitor mode,
3080 * and DLT_EN10MB isn't supported in monitor mode.
3081 */
3082static void
3083remove_en(pcap_t *p)
3084{
3085 int i, j;
3086
3087 /*
3088 * Scan the list of DLT_ values and discard DLT_EN10MB.
3089 */
3090 j = 0;
3091 for (i = 0; i < p->dlt_count; i++) {
3092 switch (p->dlt_list[i]) {
3093
3094 case DLT_EN10MB:
3095 /*
3096 * Don't offer this one.
3097 */
3098 continue;
3099
3100 default:
3101 /*
3102 * Just copy this mode over.
3103 */
3104 break;
3105 }
3106
3107 /*
3108 * Copy this DLT_ value to its new position.
3109 */
3110 p->dlt_list[j] = p->dlt_list[i];
3111 j++;
3112 }
3113
3114 /*
3115 * Set the DLT_ count to the number of entries we copied.
3116 */
3117 p->dlt_count = j;
3118}
3119
3120/*
3121 * Remove 802.11 link-layer types from the list of DLT_ values, as
3122 * we're not in monitor mode, and those DLT_ values will switch us
3123 * to monitor mode.
3124 */
3125static void
3126remove_802_11(pcap_t *p)
3127{
3128 int i, j;
3129
3130 /*
3131 * Scan the list of DLT_ values and discard 802.11 values.
3132 */
3133 j = 0;
3134 for (i = 0; i < p->dlt_count; i++) {
3135 switch (p->dlt_list[i]) {
3136
3137 case DLT_IEEE802_11:
3138 case DLT_PRISM_HEADER:
3139 case DLT_AIRONET_HEADER:
3140 case DLT_IEEE802_11_RADIO:
3141 case DLT_IEEE802_11_RADIO_AVS:
3142 /*
3143 * 802.11. Don't offer this one.
3144 */
3145 continue;
3146
3147 default:
3148 /*
3149 * Just copy this mode over.
3150 */
3151 break;
3152 }
3153
3154 /*
3155 * Copy this DLT_ value to its new position.
3156 */
3157 p->dlt_list[j] = p->dlt_list[i];
3158 j++;
3159 }
3160
3161 /*
3162 * Set the DLT_ count to the number of entries we copied.
3163 */
3164 p->dlt_count = j;
3165}
3166#endif /* defined(__APPLE__) && defined(BIOCGDLTLIST) */
3167
3168static int
3169pcap_setfilter_bpf(pcap_t *p, struct bpf_program *fp)
3170{
3171 struct pcap_bpf *pb = p->priv;
3172
3173 /*
3174 * Free any user-mode filter we might happen to have installed.
3175 */
3176 pcap_freecode(&p->fcode);
3177
3178 /*
3179 * Try to install the kernel filter.
3180 */
3181 if (ioctl(p->fd, BIOCSETF, (caddr_t)fp) == 0) {
3182 /*
3183 * It worked.
3184 */
3185 pb->filtering_in_kernel = 1; /* filtering in the kernel */
3186
3187 /*
3188 * Discard any previously-received packets, as they might
3189 * have passed whatever filter was formerly in effect, but
3190 * might not pass this filter (BIOCSETF discards packets
3191 * buffered in the kernel, so you can lose packets in any
3192 * case).
3193 */
3194 p->cc = 0;
3195 return (0);
3196 }
3197
3198 /*
3199 * We failed.
3200 *
3201 * If it failed with EINVAL, that's probably because the program
3202 * is invalid or too big. Validate it ourselves; if we like it
3203 * (we currently allow backward branches, to support protochain),
3204 * run it in userland. (There's no notion of "too big" for
3205 * userland.)
3206 *
3207 * Otherwise, just give up.
3208 * XXX - if the copy of the program into the kernel failed,
3209 * we will get EINVAL rather than, say, EFAULT on at least
3210 * some kernels.
3211 */
3212 if (errno != EINVAL) {
3213 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf, PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE,
3214 errno, "BIOCSETF");
3215 return (-1);
3216 }
3217
3218 /*
3219 * install_bpf_program() validates the program.
3220 *
3221 * XXX - what if we already have a filter in the kernel?
3222 */
3223 if (install_bpf_program(p, fp) < 0)
3224 return (-1);
3225 pb->filtering_in_kernel = 0; /* filtering in userland */
3226 return (0);
3227}
3228
3229/*
3230 * Set direction flag: Which packets do we accept on a forwarding
3231 * single device? IN, OUT or both?
3232 */
3233static int
3234pcap_setdirection_bpf(pcap_t *p, pcap_direction_t d)
3235{
3236#if defined(BIOCSDIRECTION)
3237 u_int direction;
3238
3239 direction = (d == PCAP_D_IN) ? BPF_D_IN :
3240 ((d == PCAP_D_OUT) ? BPF_D_OUT : BPF_D_INOUT);
3241 if (ioctl(p->fd, BIOCSDIRECTION, &direction) == -1) {
3242 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf, sizeof(p->errbuf),
3243 errno, "Cannot set direction to %s",
3244 (d == PCAP_D_IN) ? "PCAP_D_IN" :
3245 ((d == PCAP_D_OUT) ? "PCAP_D_OUT" : "PCAP_D_INOUT"));
3246 return (-1);
3247 }
3248 return (0);
3249#elif defined(BIOCSSEESENT)
3250 u_int seesent;
3251
3252 /*
3253 * We don't support PCAP_D_OUT.
3254 */
3255 if (d == PCAP_D_OUT) {
3256 pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, sizeof(p->errbuf),
3257 "Setting direction to PCAP_D_OUT is not supported on BPF");
3258 return -1;
3259 }
3260
3261 seesent = (d == PCAP_D_INOUT);
3262 if (ioctl(p->fd, BIOCSSEESENT, &seesent) == -1) {
3263 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf, sizeof(p->errbuf),
3264 errno, "Cannot set direction to %s",
3265 (d == PCAP_D_INOUT) ? "PCAP_D_INOUT" : "PCAP_D_IN");
3266 return (-1);
3267 }
3268 return (0);
3269#else
3270 (void) pcap_snprintf(p->errbuf, sizeof(p->errbuf),
3271 "This system doesn't support BIOCSSEESENT, so the direction can't be set");
3272 return (-1);
3273#endif
3274}
3275
3276static int
3277pcap_set_datalink_bpf(pcap_t *p, int dlt)
3278{
3279#ifdef BIOCSDLT
3280 if (ioctl(p->fd, BIOCSDLT, &dlt) == -1) {
3281 pcap_fmt_errmsg_for_errno(p->errbuf, sizeof(p->errbuf),
3282 errno, "Cannot set DLT %d", dlt);
3283 return (-1);
3284 }
3285#endif
3286 return (0);
3287}
3288
3289/*
3290 * Platform-specific information.
3291 */
3292const char *
3293pcap_lib_version(void)
3294{
3295#ifdef HAVE_ZEROCOPY_BPF
3296 return (PCAP_VERSION_STRING " (with zerocopy support)");
3297#else
3298 return (PCAP_VERSION_STRING);
3299#endif
3300}
